CONJUGATES: smooth (adj) | smoother (adj) | smoothest (adj) | more smoothly (adv) | most smoothly (adv)
ETYMOLOGY: From Middle English smothely, from Old English smōðlīce, equivalent to smooth + -ly. Ultimately from Proto-Germanic *smanþlijaz.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: adverb: modifies a verb, adjective, or other adverb
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: In an even, regular way, without sudden movements, changes, or difficulties.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 平稳地；顺利地；流畅地；无阻碍地
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The transition of power went smoothly, without any major incidents.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 权力交接进行得很顺利，没有发生任何重大事故。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: adverb: modifies a verb, adjective, or other adverb
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: In a polished, charming, or persuasive manner, sometimes implying a lack of sincerity or an intention to deceive.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 圆滑地；巧妙地；口齿伶俐地 (有时暗示不真诚或意图欺骗)
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He spoke smoothly, trying to convince her that his offer was the best.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他圆滑地说话，试图说服她他的提议是最好的。
